bibl.title: Letter from E.J. Scannell to Laura Armistead Carter, September 20, 1925

div1.p: Scannell expresses sympathy upon the death of Henry Carter.

div1.head: Letter from E.J. Scannell to Laura Armistead Carter, September 20, 1925
div1.opener:
Sept. 20, 1925.
Sunday
S.S.“DENIS.”
at Pará.
BOOTH LINE LIVERPOOL
My dear Miss Carter;
div1.p:
Please accept my heartfelt
sympathy in your great
loss.

Word just reached me
that Doctor Carter, our
best friend, has left
us for a bit.

Although your Fathers
passing was not unexpected
nevertheless it is a great
shock- All our old
Panama men will especially
feel his going, for to a
man, they not only greatly
respected but loved him.
I trust that all may
be well with you-

If at any time I
may be of service to
you please command me.
div1.closer: Very sincerely yours, E. J. Scannell.
